question.text:
Read the following statements about human reproduction:

I. A tertiary follicle is characterized by the presence of a fluid-filled cavity called the antrum.

II. The labia minora are fleshy folds of tissue, extend down the mons pubis, and surround the vaginal orifice.

III. Most of the major organ system of the fetus is formed by the end of the second month of pregnancy.

IV. The mammary glands of the female start producing milk during pregnancy.

How many statements are incorrect from the above?

solution.text: A tertiary follicle is characterized by the presence of a fluid-filled cavity called the antrum. The labia majora are fleshy folds of tissue, extend down the mons pubis, and surround the vaginal orifice. Most of the major organ systems of the fetus are formed by the end of 12 weeks of pregnancy. The mammary glands of the female starts producing milk during pregnancy.
